name: coaction
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of two or more things or people working together, especially to have an effect or to achieve something: The coactions of genes and environment give rise to specific patterns in the brain. When we actively engage in co-action with others, there are changes in our reaction time, search behaviour, and other processes.
More examplesFewer examplesExperiences may have similar elements and yet, in coaction with other factors, lead to very different outcomes.Researchers integrate work conducted on the behavioural level with the biological and genetic levels, and examine their coactions. The numeric display panel requires data processor coaction for operation.
